storyInfo: A Rose Riverside's Canoe finds the trail of her missing princess in Londinium, but she does not expect yet another parting waiting for her at its end.

attributes.text: The soil of this foreign land is soaked with the blood of the Sarkaz.
Churned, jumbled. I can sense a chaotic mess of emotions tangled together.
Hesitation, wrath, cowardice, homesickness. Was this what you wished for, Your Highness?
Sleep, my kin. As long as blood continues to flow, relief from pain will soon follow.
...Have I arrived too late? Perhaps.
If the war can truly come to an end, if this end can truly determine who wins and who loses... When have we Sarkaz ever won, I ask?
I have never been fond of watching the clock, mind you. I prefer to keep time with the pulsing of my heart.
It told me to come here, and so I came.

attributes.content: As far as I was aware, Rose Riverside was dissolved after your princess fled far away and the Canoes scattered.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Quite a few former Canoes have gone on to serve the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Reestablishing our long-lost contact right after the Commission's decline suggests you want something from me. I can't guarantee you'll get it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Not even for old-time's sake? You're the same as ever, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: It's hard to believe how much Amiya has grown. No doubt she's keeping an eye on me, yes?
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: A necessary precaution.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Logos warned us of your appearance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Since we withdrew from the falling airship, you are the first outsider to reach our safe house.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...'Outsider'.
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: Are you like me, Dame Kal'tsit—most difficult to persuade when we're in the throes of grief?
attributes.name: Mysterious Vampire

attributes.content: This is not a Babel safe house, Entelechia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hearing that codename coming from your lips truly takes me back.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I passed by the charnel house that is Londinium on my way here. I rescued a few fortunate souls, and sent off a few unfortunate ones.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: It brings me no joy to see my countrymen spill their blood on foreign soil, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I don't recall you being such a sentimental person.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Vampire goes silent. Kal'tsit sees she has no intention of answering.
Why would you risk crossing the battlefields of Victoria to see me, Entelechia?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you require assistance, Theresis would be the better option.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No need for these probing questions, Kal'tsit. I'd rather not have anything to do with the Regent. Perhaps some of the sisters agree with him, but as you know...
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Ever since Her Highness Theresa's untimely accident at Babel, there has been less and less contact between us. Our sororal bonds have weakened.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: But that is not why I came to find you, Kal'tsit. I intend to help Ascalon with a trifling matter, one that will allow her to enter the city a tad easier.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: What do you want?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: According to our latest intelligence, the Military Commission is strengthening its control within the city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer troops and the ducal armies are facing each other down at the city walls. The situation is ever-changing.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Oh, I know, I know. But such an adorable and studious youngster as her is well worth the effort to look after.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: That is not what I mean. Given the circumstances, you should have been unable to find any trace of Ascalon. I am very familiar with her ways.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She is wounded. Gravely so.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: She's never used something like that as an excuse to lower her guard.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You really trust her. It's hard to say whether I should be happy or worried for her that you hold her in such high regard.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Who is helping you with this?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Trickster, one of our sharp-eyed sisters. As a technician, she was able to hunt down a few clues I was looking for in Londinium.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Her? I remember you all cherished her and would never have approved of putting her in the middle of this battle. And according to the vows made by all you Canoes, none of you should even be here.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...As I suspected, you know of our plight. Her intelligence was right. You have a trail leading to the princess.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: As I'm sure you're well aware, Dame, I am the only one who will not and can not leave this river of blood.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Do you still doubt me, even after all I said?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Rhodes Island thanks you for your assistance. We will repay the Canoes in kind, just as Theresa did during the Babel years.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I will tell you all I know in regard to that princess.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Thank you, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: On another note, while I was in the bowels of the city, I caught a whiff of Duq'arael's stench. While I would love to help settle that matter for you while I'm there—
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I will need help from your people.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'm afraid Rhodes Island does not have any more to spare inside the city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is a local faction known as Millscar. Finding them should not be a challenge for you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They are close to the heart of the storm, but are determined to avoid entangling themselves with any of the involved parties. A stance you would find familiar, I'm sure.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You would trust someone like that?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: We retain shared interests, for the time being.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If the Military Commission has other plans for Duq'arael's arrangements, they will undoubtedly affect the ducal alliance's next moves... or even disrupt the Exemplars' plans to enter the city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Neither Rhodes Island nor Millscar wishes to see such an outcome.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Haha. You really haven't changed one bit. Did this plan come from you, or that commander of yours?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: It is Rhodes Island's plan.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Rhodes Island. Very well, do send my regards to your commander. Though I fear I'm simply another lost memory at this point.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Dame, there is a question that's been eating away at me, one I was hoping you could answer.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Aside from His Highness the Regent, I'm afraid only you hold the answer. After all, you were the only ones who made it from the airship.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Is a question you already know the answer to really so important?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Of course it is.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: If one does not see it with one's own eyes, hear it with one's own ears, say it with one's own mouth, then saying goodbye becomes quite a challenge.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Even though my heart sensed the echo of the myriad souls as they left with such clarity, I still ask myself over and over if she was among them.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: And so I must ask... Has Her Highness left us once more?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: <p=1>Southern Region of Kazdel</><p=2>Summer, 1094, after the fall of Babel</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: I've left you your life, and a knife. I'd say that's a very generous price for answering my question.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Who hired you all to kill me? Few even know of our existence.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'm dead either way, so do me a favor and be quick about it—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: 'Release' him.
I mean with a quick death like he asked for, Entelechia.
attributes.name: Young Sarkaz

attributes.content: As long as he spills enough blood, you can always just tear out the memories you want from him, right?
attributes.name: Young Sarkaz

attributes.content: Well, since you mention it—
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The Vampire raises her hand.
The crimson shackles binding the mercenary disappear into nothingness.
I find I'm rather against that suggestion.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Go on then, mercenary. As you can see, I have far too many people trying to kill me at the moment. I shan't be remembering your face.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: No need to thank me.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Watching that cringeworthy performance of yours was painful.
attributes.name: Young Sarkaz

attributes.content: Not many know the name 'Rose Riverside'. I didn't have to do anything to him to guess who's hunting us.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Her Highness has only just left us, and those who have hidden in the shadows for too long are only too eager to act.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: You played your part well, though. Otherwise, it would have been such a bother finding an excuse to let him go.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Don't misunderstand me. Her Highness is dead, and I have no intention of following the Regent to throw my life away in Victoria.
attributes.name: Young Sarkaz

attributes.content: Which is why I found my own way forward, one that lets me live.
attributes.name: Young Sarkaz

attributes.content: It almost sounds like you want to kill me too, Milton.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Even if I did, I couldn't touch you... or any of you, for that matter.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: If not, I'd have taken back my sister a long time ago.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: You best make yourself scarce, then.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The young mixed-blood Sarkaz does not do so, instead tightening his grip on his knife.
Hah.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: You helped your sister deliver messages, which is why I remember you. My memories hold true, and whatever your role may be now, it has no bearing on them—
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: You and I both know what Her Highness's passing means for Kazdel.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: I sense a storm approaching, and none of us can escape it.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: I do not wish for your sister to mourn. Leave while you still can.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The situation is rather murky at the moment, and the sisters have scattered. Even I am having trouble tracking them down.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The chaos in Kazdel has forced me to bid many a farewell. There are fewer and fewer informants I can speak to as the days go by.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I do not intend on losing another sister because of you.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: ...There's nowhere any of you can hide.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Most of the people after you aren't doing it out of hatred, but for the information you have.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Even if the Military Commission says they won't hunt down anyone with ties to Babel, do you really think they'd let you waltz away with all those secrets spilling out of your pockets?
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'd like to see them try and stop me.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: You're on a fool's errand, Milton.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'm just a worthless merc, but if I really do manage to bring your head in, at least I'll have a chance to protect my sister.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: I'm out of options, Entelechia!
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: With a burst of speed, the young Sarkaz swings his sword, but Entelechia's scythe does not block his attack as he expected.
Instead, the Vampire's body slowly dissipates like a fog of blood, fading into the background.
Tch.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: You could have been more honest from the start.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: If I promise you that none living shall approach this street, will you speak with candor?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Yes, exactly what you're thinking. Your friends in ambush will not be coming.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: You're not as calm as you're pretending to be either.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: You pretend your pursuers bother you and claim you acted only to expose a traitor.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Then you send everyone who finds you back to reveal your location, all so that anyone with a grudge against the Canoes will focus solely on you.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: I heard from my sister that you were the one who cleaned up after every operation. The cleaner, they call you.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Once when she barely escaped by the skin of her teeth, you used a similar method to draw attention to yourself.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Though it involved faking an injury that time. You were losing a lot of blood, true, but the Arts you used was powerful enough to turn everyone who even glanced at you into a fine red mist.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: My sister risked her life to let you all 'cleanse' her blood, turning her into a pure Vampire... but even she couldn't eat for days after seeing that.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: I did endeavor not to splash too much blood. I'm not fond of working in such a garish fashion myself—
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: No. What I hate is your arrogance.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: You think you can bear the entire blood debt of Rose Riverside by yourself.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: ...And what makes you say that?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: If I really were as capable as you claim, I would have held on to my sisters and have them accompany me upon this river of blood.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: And Rose Riverside would not have scattered so prematurely...
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I wish I'd had time to do more than clean-up duty during the crux of the civil war. I was so busy I didn't even hear the whispers in the wind.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: And that was that. I could not save Theresa, nor a single Canoe.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Even what you're willing to do for your sister now, I cannot do myself.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: What the—?!
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: A sparkling, blood-red gem slowly falls in front of Milton, as Entelechia's countenance grows even paler.
Take it back to the one you believe can save your sister. There are only two people in this entire land who can tell the difference between it and my Little Garnet. I can promise you that much.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Your... earring?
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: More than that... but you needn't know. Now go.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I wish you the best of luck, just as I do for my sisters.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: Judging by what you're holding, am I not already slain by your hand?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: If you have the chance to see your sister again, tell her I will find that woman, and have her provide an answer to all us sisters.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: This princess of yours, is she a traitor? A liar? Or something else?
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: By the time the scent of blood wafts over in the breeze, she has already gone.
...Thank you.
attributes.name: Milton

attributes.content: <p=1>Interior of the Shard, Londinium</><p=2>October 1098</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Can you hear me?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'm inside the Military Commission's command center. The communications shutdown has been lifted.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: That's mighty quick of you, Entelechia.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Naturally. Same old trick of mine.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: While I was dealing with Duq'arael's altar, I found quite a few people lying in pools of blood. Some were closer to the Military Commission than others.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: There was still information on the command center in their memories.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Ah... Seems my divination today was off the mark.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Today's blood drops were in the shape of two swords. Thought it meant you would have to face off against the Royal Court's army and have a tough time getting in.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Still playing at fortune teller, are you?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The sound of something falling passes through the wireless communicator, distant and fuzzy.
...Are you alright over there?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Dammit, tripped over a cable again.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Anyway, with a body as bad as mine, I'm not casting any crazy blood Arts any time soon. Just let me mess around with a couple of drops now and then, okay?
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Won't you consider telling me where you're hiding right now?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Why fix what isn't broken? Even back in Rose Riverside, when we Canoes were close as anything, nobody knew my hiding place.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: But now that you're in Londinium, there's nowhere that can guarantee your safety.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: No need to worry about me.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Found the target, to the northeast. Sounds like there are two teams. Make sure to avoid them.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: We may have destroyed the Commission's command structure, but the mercenaries who are taking it over are unfamiliar faces.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: —Bzzzzz...
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: ...Are you still there?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'm here. Sisters working together, just like old times.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Yes, just like old times.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The three in charge of those mercenaries had some past dealings with Babel.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I may be here at Kal'tsit's request, but I doubt we would get very far using our old friendship as leverage.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Would you say this goes against our sisterly vows?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'd say it all depends on how you see it. No Canoe shall interfere in matters related to Babel... It was you who set that rule.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Some people don't really mind killing their own, you know.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: With more rules comes less trouble. I know what us sisters are like... and how bad the blood can run between us at times.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Yep. Some join, so obviously there'll be some who leave too.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: We have to accept that, Entelechia.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: This does not explain her sudden disappearance, though. I should think that I know her the best.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Obviously. No one else has got a single drop of her blood on them.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Which means her departure was truly without warning, rather than us missing a sign.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Sounds like you've doubted yourself.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Join the club. It was only after it happened that I really got into this 'divination' thing.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: It's never accurate, more like a game of associations that gets you thinking. But at least it gives me some sort of warning, reminding me to be mentally ready for any and all changes.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: I'll help you out. At the very least, we know she came by Londinium.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Two heads are better than one, and one clue's better than none, right—
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Hold on. There's movement outside the command center. Victorian alliance troops are locking horns with a group of unknown Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: Those would be the mercenaries who have come to take charge.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: It would seem they're right behind us.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I'll tidy up this command center for them then, save them the trouble later.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Would you mind leading the way?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: No problem. I'm always here.
attributes.name: Voice over the Wireless

attributes.content: <p=1>Londinium</><p=2>After Babel's seizure of the Military Commission command center</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Entelechia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...You're late, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Drafting a final plan of attack demanded my time. It's rare to see you absent-minded.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Rhodes Island's medical operators can provide standard medical aid, but if a Vampire does not wish to staunch their own bleeding, I'm afraid there is little they can do.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's nothing. Who doesn't bleed a little in battle?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I was simply pondering the shape this bloodstain has taken. It seems like a bad omen, no?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: But do go on, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: ...Forgive me, but as usual, I can only thank you in a personal capacity for destroying Duq'arael's remaining Arts circles and saving Londinium from yet another calamity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To be fair, I only did so out of my loathing for Duq'arael.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: It wasn't to help you, and certainly not to help those Victorians.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Nonetheless, your action helped clear many obstacles for Wiš'adel and her people.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: True, true. I trust you'll remember my help today, Dame.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Naturally. About the information you gleaned from within the Arts circles of blood, have you told Millscar?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Just a hint, but that little kitten is smart enough to figure it out.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: When the Victorians and Sarkaz began hostilities, it was inevitable that some among them would seek cooperation over common interests.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This war must end. These problems must be left to Londinium, to Victoria itself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Amiya and the Doctor are currently fighting their own fight with the Victorian delegation to bring things to a peaceful close.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If negotiations go as we hope, all the Sarkaz will leave at the appointed time. The tragedy of Londinium can end.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The more one knows about the past, the more worries it add to their brow.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It almost sounds like you're mocking yourself, O Nearly-All-Knowing Dame Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Four years ago, I found a Babel in complete disarray. We may have had our similarities in that sense.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Us cleaners really hate having to leave, and are disinclined to accept defeat. So I stayed, wanting to piece back together all the shattered fragments.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: ...As promised, I've synced what I know about your princess to the frequency band you provided. It's just scraps of information, but it should be enough to help you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Thank you, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: If you and Rhodes Island still need any assistance, do tell me now. Getting all the Sarkaz to agree to leave is hardly the easiest matter, after all.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: There is one thing you must know. The person receiving this information did not respond.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Closure managed to triangulate the approximate location of the band signal, albeit with great difficulty, but our people were prevented from approaching.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No, rather than 'prevented', they were being distracted. This sort of activity can only mean there are people in the shadows with their own purposes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: After me, perhaps?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.text: 'No need to be in such a rush, Entelechia. Run as fast as you like, but that bouquet will wilt before you get past that battlefield no matter what.'
'There are no roses in Kazdel, true. Even if you do bring some for your sisters to see, they might not like them. You should toss the bouquet once the flowers are wilted.'
'I am also unsure what awaits us once we return to the city of the Sarkaz.'
'Though with how well you've become in combat and Arts, there should only be one thing you need to be ready for.'
'I hope you have learned how to grieve, how to say farewell, Entelechia. It is easy to live with a heart full of hate, but it is hard to bear the pain of love.'
'Saying farewell is what causes us to grieve. And so, I will see Her Highness Theresa's wish fulfilled.'
'I want you there with me when it becomes fulfilled.'
'Will you agree to that, Entelechia?'

attributes.content: Entelechia enters the ruins.
A few frightened civilians follow her at a distance, their eyes locked onto her, muttering curses under their breath. None dare to throw the bricks they hold in their hands.
A dried streak of blood trails across the ground, as if someone was dragged. It winds past a fallen wall, wrecked in the fighting, and skirts around a rusty assembly line.
Trickster lies motionless, her face drained of blood, a shattered receiver still clutched tightly in her arms.
Blood drips out of the terrifying wound on her, crimson as ever.
A frail Vampire died in Londinium, a sight all too common. Nobody cares why she died, but nobody can take away her dignity in death.
Your blood still isn't dry... Someone has kept the last of your dignity.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: ...Only someone living can leave behind minute Arts such as this, Arts of life—
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: My Princess, is this... is this all the mercy you could spare?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.text: 'You ended up coming here after all, Entelechia.'

attributes.content: As her finger dips into the blood, a host of information springs up before her eyes. Through this blood, Entelechia communes with the consciousness of the deceased before it disperses completely.
...Who killed you?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.text: 'I hid away too long and got hungry, decided to go out for a walk. Someone hit me. I knew I couldn't escape, so I didn't bother to stop the bleeding.'

attributes.content: As Rose Riverside's 'cleaner', she has seen too many of her compatriots fallen in pools of their own blood.
The shadows of these grisly scenes serve as elucidators of information in her mind's eye, fitting together into a vague memory.
Was it the Victorians, or the Military Commission—
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.text: 'No need to be mad at anyone about this. If Rose Riverside hadn't taken me in, a Vampire as weak as me wouldn't have made it past the civil war.'
'You all always said I was the only one of us sisters with sharp eyes, so whenever any surprises happened, even a small breakdown at the Furnace, I'd be the first you all fussed over.'
'That's all I ever needed. I'm so glad I met you all.'

attributes.content: The memories continue further into the past. A familiar figure steps out of the river of blood, quietly watching them.
It is Trickster's memory, and the memories of all the Canoes. As the warmth dies away in the blood, so too does the memory of the dead slowly dry up.
Not many Canoes have left them, but none left in silence. No matter how dire the situation, they always spared the time to grieve for a lost sister.
At least, they did, once upon a time.
No, wait—What about the people we're looking for? Are you really alright with this?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Didn't you want to bring back all our sisters too?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: She sees no information. There is no answer from the blood.
But unexpectedly, her finger touches something solid.

attributes.text: 'Take away your hand. Do not tarry in this river of blood.'

attributes.content: She knows this crystal. Of course she does.
It is a drop of her own blood. A vow. The beginning of Rose Riverside.
There is no information within the pure crystal, merely the lingering warmth of Arts.
My Princess... Why did you choose to return this to me now? Why now, of all times?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: You were here, so why did you leave so soon?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Was it because you could not save her? Or was it because of the war that barely ended? Because of all that transpired years ago?
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Or maybe... it's simply to say farewell...
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Not planning on staying in Londinium?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I have found the answer I sought.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: That princess of yours did come by this city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Neither the Military Commission's information network nor our covert web in Londinium could find anything on her. This is not good for us.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She did not come here for the war.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: 'Rose Riverside will no longer take part in anything to do with Babel.' A rule I set myself. She would not have violated it.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, she may have simply come to say farewell to Her Highness... Or perhaps it was to stop Trickster and I from continuing our search...
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The sudden disappearance of your princess on the eve of Babel's collapse is suspicious enough. I cannot even confirm if she left on Theresa's orders.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Until we know where she truly stands, Rhodes Island cannot rule out the possibility that she might interfere with our plans.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if I too wish to believe that she has simply come to say her goodbyes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I will find her, Kal'tsit. The final clues Trickster left for me will be enough.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: She owes me an answer, too.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: If you need assistance, we are still happy to—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know you are going to say that Rhodes Island wants to help.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: But Rhodes Island and Babel are very different beasts. I do not wish for Rhodes Island to be ensnared in the past once again. I believe Her Highness would not want it either.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Our name may have changed, Entelechia, but our mission hasn't.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Rhodes Island will not continue down Babel's doomed path, but we will never deny the ideals Babel showed us.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Besides, I want the truth too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...I thank you for your kindness.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: A drifting canoe needs its berth, and for us, that can only be Kazdel...
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: The Royal Court, shaped by Duq'arael, reeks with a stench that displeases the sisters. No doubt, sooner or later, another vile creature will emerge from his pool of blood.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Perhaps I will rope in some other Canoes in due time, to cross the river of blood once more, and return to the city Her Highness built.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I foresee Kazdel having even greater need of us in the wake of this war than Babel ever did.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: I fear persuading those sisters of yours will not be easy. Not to mention your drifter of a princess.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I believe in the vows of us Canoes, even if many of us detest each other.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: Send this petal of Trickster's to Kazdel in my stead, Dame. See her home.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: She slowly opens her hand, revealing a sparkling, blood-red crystal. She did all she could to preserve the longing lingering in her sister's veins.
You have my promise, and Rhodes Island's as well.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then don't blame me when trouble comes knocking on your door.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.content: It has been a long time since Rhodes Island was as weak as you imagine, Entelechia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We can only hope. Goodbye, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Entelechia

attributes.text: 'The warmth in this drop of blood will never die, just as us Canoes will never drown in the river of blood. This is our vow.'
'I promise you...'
'For our farewell, I shall grieve. I would much prefer to part less often, but...'
'...Goodbye, Entelechia.'
